risk_factors: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma of the tongue (human papillomavirus–positive)

imaging_findings.computed_tomography_of_the_neck_with_con: Gas in the upper cervical spinal canal with a heterogeneous mass on the right side of the tongue
imaging_findings.magnetic_resonance_imaging_of_the_cervic: C2-C3 epidural abscess anteriorly consistent with a 3.4 × 1.4 × 0.8 cm epidural abscess with cord compression
imaging_findings.repeat_magnetic_resonance_imaging_of_the: Epidural collection at the C2-C3 level with surrounding edema

required: Clinical presentation consistent with meningitis (neck pain, confusion, fever, drowsiness, neck stiffness)
Abnormal cerebrospinal fluid findings (elevated protein, low glucose, high white blood cell count, predominantly neutrophils)
Isolation of Actinomyces species from culture (surgical biopsy or abscess drainage)
supportive: Imaging findings suggestive of epidural abscess or meningitis
Gram stain showing gram-positive cocci in pairs and short chains
